page.title: 01LOCAL & CENTRAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: {MAGHERAFELT}houses the offices of the{ {Magherafelt District Council}.It is one of the twenty_six local councils in Northern Ireland.The council has 15 members.Mr.R.S.McMaster is Clerk and Chief Executive of the council.It employs 24 office staff and 120 manual staff.The offices were built in 1961. In 1973 the title changed from Magherafelt Rural Council to Magherafelt District Council.The present chairman is Mr.Pat Sweeney. A number of central government depertments have offices in Magherafelt.These include the Department of Agriculture, whose staff advise local farmers,the Department of Health and Social Services and the Department of the Environment.The Northern Health and Social Services Board have an office. There is also a Job Centre.
